alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued June 12 at 1:53PM MDT until June 14 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM TO 8 PM MDT TODAY FOR NORTHEAST AND EAST CENTRAL NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, NEAR RECORD HEAT, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MONDAY FOR ALL OF NORTHERN AND CENTRAL NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR NORTHEAST AND EAST CENTRAL NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... .An upper level trough will approach from the west today, allowing southwest winds to increase across parts of northern New Mexico. The combination of strong winds with very low humidity, near record heat, and an unstable airmass will generate critical fire weather conditions. Winds will continue to strengthen across the area Monday, and with very low humidity and well above normal temperatures, critical fire weather conditions will become more widespread across northern and eastern New Mexico. The upper trough passes to our north Tuesday with the strongest winds and continued dry conditions over much of eastern New Mexico. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT MONDAY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...East Central Plains, Northeast Plains and Highlands. A Red Flag warning remains in effect from 2 PM to 8 PM MDT today and Monday from noon to 8 PM MDT. A Fire Weather Watch is in effect from Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph today. Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph Monday. Southwest to west 20 to 30 mph with gusts to around 40 mph Tuesday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...5 to 10 percent today, Monday and Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: East Central Plains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains
